rmp.university: University of North Carolina at Chapel Hill
comments: Sarah Booker has definitely been the best professor I've had so far. She is easy to talk to and very understanding. There are a decent amount of small projects and a lot MSL assignments, but they are beneficial in helping you understand the course material. She doesn't aim to destroy your grades and gives students many opportunities to perform well

Sarah is a really great professor. We speak English probably just as much as we speak Spanish, so maybe it's not the best for a Spanish minor or major, but this course is perfect for someone who just wants to take 203 and complete the language requirement. She is also really friendly and understanding.

rmp.university: University of North Carolina at Chapel Hill
comments: I loved Prof Elena; she was my favorite professor. SPAN is difficult because it's a foreign language, but she is willing to help in any way possible. Easy to understand, knows how to teach at the level of her students. The tests were hard, but that's to be expected. Do your work, PARTICIPATE, be a good person, and you'll pass. I loved Prof Elena

The best teacher I've had at UNC! She is respectful, kind, knowledgeable, clear, and helpful. She does an excellent job at answering any question. First Spanish class I had taken in 2 years, and her helpfulness saved me. If you are looking for an easy A look elsewhere. Professora Casey challenges you to do your best and learn the most! Excellent.

rmp.university: University of North Carolina at Chapel Hill
comments: Professor Maisch is very enthusiastic about Spanish and sharing his knowledge. His class is less interactive than previous Spanish classes that I've taken and he likes to talk a lot. However, he emphasized things like accent, pronunciation, and ability to communicate with native speakers that I hadn't learned in other classes and that will help me.

Professor Maisch is a really great guy. He's willing to get to know his students, and it's worth getting to know him -- he's always willing to help you out in a pinch, and he was happy to write letters of recommendation for multiple students in my class. Beware that SPAN204 is tough, and you have to study to be prepared for class, but it's doable.

I learned a lot from Professor Maisch. He is a funnygoofy guy that's super passionate about Spanish.  However, he talks really fast, goes off on tangents easily, and isn't super clear.  If you don't have an affinity for languages or don't have the willingness to work hard, this class may not be for you. He loves the culture and it shows.

Honestly, I found this professor to be quite patronizing... Whenever a student asked for help or clarification in class, he would tut-tut them and make them feel stupid for asking. Not very conducive for a good learning environment or for active class participation, especially when people are afraid to talk in a foreign language already!

Don't get me wrong, he is a very nice guy and loves his job but as far as "teaching"  his class is more like self guided learning.  He will assign something you have never even seen in class and expect you to know how to do it.  Very difficult and challenging professor, very strict on grading.
Good professor, he was helpful and encouraging even to the worst student. I learned a great deal from his class, and his teaching style was effective. Overall good class, and not that hard
Very goofy guy, but energetic enough to keep you interested (even if it is way too early in the morning). Somewhat tough grader, but only because he has to be. I'd highly recommend him.

rmp.university: University of North Carolina at Chapel Hill
comments: I've loved nearly every minute of this class, which I didn't necessarily think I would. She's funny (sometimes unintentionally so) and she's pretty relatable as a human being. Sometimes she's tough on grading, but if you have some kind of extenuating circumstance she will gladly work with you to figure things out.

I LOVE PROFE DE FAYS!! she is absolutely HILARIOUS and truly cares about you! i have had some attendance issues because of things going on outside of class, and she really is understanding and works to meet you halfway. she does give points for partipation everyday, so it is important to raise your hand. she is great if you truly want to learn span

Profesora de Fays is really funny and engaging in a small (20) class; she makes jokes and can tell when we're bored. She really wants participation and you get daily points for it. She was available for help and very forgiving if you attend class and engage. Importance of readings is inversely related to how well you understand her spoken Spanish.

I personally didn't like her. When we did presentations, I spoke fluently and with a pretty good accent (I've taken Spanish since 2nd grade) but I'd always get a B or a B+; yet, the girl with a pretty bad accent and constant pauses gets an A...

Excellent teacher. She is knowledgeable, approachable and reliable. She respects her students and encourages them. You have to work hard and cover a lot of material. She brings it all together with a sophisticated, cosmopolitan sensibility.

Super nice and approachable. The class can get boring at times, but she does her best to keep it interesting and keep students engaged. It's also pretty much a guaranteed A or B if you do the reading and study for the quizzes.

I took Spanish 101 last semester, and, while being very likeable, it seemed like she was impatient/uninterested with teaching us beginners new material. She covered subjects too fast and did not seem sympathetic to beginner problems. She was very funny and pleasant to be in class with, though, and i ended with a B+ in the class.
Very friendly and easy going person.  330 covered a little too much (ancient times through 1917), but was extremely interesting.
One word, boring. Had a big lecture class with her. Easy though.

She keeps the class interesting and definitely has a sense of humor.  Her class isn't the easiest but as long as you pay attention and ask questions, it turns out fine.  She is a great person in general!

rmp.university: University of North Carolina at Chapel Hill
comments: Martín is great honestly. He's low key hilarious and he cares about his students. Unfortunately he does not design the tests for 204 otherwise they would be much easier. Most of the class is participation based and he really emphasizes conversation. 8/10 would recommend

Awesome professor. He does have a heavy accent (from Argentina), but if you are in 204 you shouldn't have problems with this. Class participation is very important and definitely helps your grade. Sueldo makes sure that everyone is involved in the material and incorporates a lot of group work in the lessons. Huge focus on speaking and conversation.
Very clear about what he wants, easy and interesting readings. He's low-key funny. This was one of the easiest Spanish classes I've taken because he teaches very well
Great teacher will help you if you show the effort.

rmp.university: University of North Carolina at Chapel Hill
comments: Martín is great honestly. He's low key hilarious and he cares about his students. Unfortunately he does not design the tests for 204 otherwise they would be much easier. Most of the class is participation based and he really emphasizes conversation. 8/10 would recommend

Awesome professor. He does have a heavy accent (from Argentina), but if you are in 204 you shouldn't have problems with this. Class participation is very important and definitely helps your grade. Sueldo makes sure that everyone is involved in the material and incorporates a lot of group work in the lessons. Huge focus on speaking and conversation.
Very clear about what he wants, easy and interesting readings. He's low-key funny. This was one of the easiest Spanish classes I've taken because he teaches very well
Great teacher will help you if you show the effort.

Sometimes she's tough on grading, but if you have some kind of extenuating circumstance she will gladly work with you to figure things out.

Excellent teacher. She is knowledgeable, approachable and reliable. She respects her students and encourages them. You have to work hard and cover a lot of material. She brings it all together with a sophisticated, cosmopolitan sensibility.

Super nice and approachable. The class can get boring at times, but she does her best to keep it interesting and keep students engaged. It's also pretty much a guaranteed A or B if you do the reading and study for the quizzes.

I took Spanish 101 last semester, and, while being very likeable, it seemed like she was impatient/uninterested with teaching us beginners new material. She covered subjects too fast and did not seem sympathetic to beginner problems. She was very funny and pleasant to be in class with, though, and i ended with a B+ in the class.
Very friendly and easy going person.  330 covered a little too much (ancient times through 1917), but was extremely interesting.
One word, boring. Had a big lecture class with her. Easy though.

She keeps the class interesting and definitely has a sense of humor.  Her class isn't the easiest but as long as you pay attention and ask questions, it turns out fine.  She is a great person in general!

rmp.university: University of North Carolina at Chapel Hill
comments: Abel is a very knowledgable professor who makes his classes very interesting. His enthusiasm for the topic (Contemporary Spanish history) was very evident, and it was clear that he wanted us to learn. Participation is very important in his classes and is a significant portion of the grade. He is always willing to help and wants his students to try.

Great guy and great professor. You're going to have to put in a good amount of work, but you can get an A and he will help you get it. He wants to help whenever he can and is always making jokes. If you like Spanish and want to learn, take this class. If you don't like Spanish, don't take it.

Professor Monoz-Hermoso is definitely not the easiest professor I have had, but I learned so much in his class and could really feel my speaking-ability improving. He loves having discussions about issues of morality or historical events. Don't take this class if you don't like speaking in class because participation is everything.

I enjoyed nearly every aspect of this class, and I would highly recommend it to everyone. I mean, this professor is generally very understanding and wants to encourage students to do well. If you're lucky you'll get to experience the Spanish sense of humor and get to hear some cool music in class.

He has a thing about making sure it's "los problemas" and not "las", but he's great. He gives chances to make up for it when you forget to turn in homework (or just aren't there). But there is daily homework, and you never know what he'll take up.

My favorite professor at UNC. He can come across as intimidating, but if you take the time to go to his office and get to know him he is a GREAT guy. Participation is the key to your grade in this class. If you do the work this is definitely a class you can make an A in. But you have to take it seriously, he hates apathy.

I really liked him. He's a funny guy. His sense of humor is very dry though, and if you're really sensitive you might be offended. I felt like I had to teach myself some, but overall I thought he was a good professor. He kept class entertaining and interesting, and there's music every Friday!

He likes to make jokes in his class, so don't get offended if he teases you. I thought he was funny. The class went great until we had to learn something new. When he was teaching it to us, he got easily frustrated with our questions. The amount of homework was reasonable, I found the tests to be difficult, and participation is really important.

Really liked this professor...keeps class interesting and entertaining. You will learn a lot if you do the readings and pay attention. Exams are straight forward. Big on participation, be ready with questions and comments. Not too much homework, just a paper, readings, and occasional hw. Only setback was occasional lack of clarity w/ hw.Great class

So incredibly hard and very condescending.  Pretty sure he normalizes his grades, since I had an A going into the exam and a B- coming out (even though I know I didn't flunk the test).  Unless you suck up to him pretty hard, be prepared to find yourself on his 'apathy' list.
Funny man that is interested in the subject. A lot of reading, but a do-able class. Don't get overwhelmed right at the beginning!

There was a major problem with the calculation of my grade.  He was incredibly unresponsive when I went to him for assistance and I would up going over him to the head of the department.  He balked at her, but my grade was finally changed.
he's a funny guy and very interested in teaching this class.  I would recommend him to anyone.  Do the homework, participate and review grammar for the tests and your good
Great professor.  He is funny, engaging, and keeps the class interesting.  He is big on participation, so doing the homework is beneficial, even though it's not graded.

Very goofy guy, but energetic enough to keep you interested (even if it is way too early in the morning). Somewhat tough grader, but only because he has to be. I'd highly recommend him.
